intro: Terebinthus vulgaris, commonly known as the common terebinth, is a deciduous tree native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Burseraceae family and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and alternate, simple leaves. The tree produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by spherical, woody fruits containing three seeds. Its resin, historically used in incense and medicine, is one of its notable botanical features. The plant is adapted to dry, rocky soils and thrives in temperate climates.
